content.description: The left bolted route on the Block. Crux is near the top. The top of the climb is a bit contrived as the last bolt is way to the left of the second to last bolt then the anchors were back to the right. It's a good thing the route is so short or there could be serious drag issues with this route. The second to last bolt also had a very loose hanger on it. The bolt may need to be tightened down. Just something to beware of if you plan on leading the route.
content.location: Left bolted route on the Block formation.

content.description: This is the obvious roof/flake on the most right section of the block. Rarely climbed, and often done on top rope. The route has been lead on gear.
content.protection: Avg rack will suffice. Mostly cams.
content.location: Furthermost route on the right. Shares anchors with it's neighbor.

content.description: This climb is a bit contrived and moves through some easy bulges down low then to some slabby moves up higher. The rock is good but the grading in the "Climber's Guide to North Idaho..." is way soft. He rates it at 5.9+. I would say it's around a 5.8 to 5.8+ at the most. Moves are all straight forward.
content.location: Right bolted route on the Block.
